result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl E. Dickerson II

records.addlTxt: Pre-Trial Conference set for 11/14/22 - not deliverable as addressed

Atty Soule wishes to proceed knowing an Amended Information may be filed with regards to the felony bail jumping charge.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

State is in compliance with victim rights legislation and no victims appear at today's hearing.

3:30 PM Defendant Carl E. Dickerson III in court, in custody.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Carl E. Dickerson III.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appears for ADA Kelly A Cassidy for State of Wisconsin.

Clerk corrects the defendants suffix of his name to read III and not II.

3:30 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, Copy of Criminal Complaint, is marked for ADA Mutchler.
3:32 p.m.  Deputy Potocki is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Mutchler. 
3:35 p.m  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Record reflects that the witness has identified the defendant.
3:37 p.m.  ADA Mutchler references exhibit #P1.
ADA Mutchler would ask that the court take judicial notice of Portage County Case 22CF249.
Atty Soule has no comment.
BY THE COURT: 
Court takes Judicial Notice of 22CF249.
Court informs that a bond had been imposed but not signed.
Atty Soule states that this is correct as her client has not been able to post the bond.
3:40 p.m.  ADA Mutchler would offer exhibit #P1 into evidence, subject to cross examination.  No objections by Atty Soule.  Received by the Court.
Cross examination by Atty Soule.
3:41 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Mutchler.
ADA Mutchler has no further witnesses.
Atty Soule has no recross.
ADA Mutchler has no further witnesses.
ADA Mutchler gives final argument.
Atty Soule has no witnesses and no argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:32 PM Defendant Carl E. Dickerson II appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Atty Taylor O Soule on behalf of Carl E. Dickerson II.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Preliminary Hearing to be held within time limits.
Court questions the defendant as to why he is in custody.
He responds.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

Defendant questions if the can have a bond modification in another case.
Atty Bergner is to let Atty Soule know that he wishes to have a bond modification.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
State is to complete and Order to Produce to bring the defendant back to Portage County for the Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 10/10/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 3

Follow all conditions of bond on his open cases.
No contact with victim C. O.

1:44 PM Defendant Carl Eugene Dickerson III in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Battery by Prisoner and Bail Jumping. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is  eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a  bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
